results.title: Boys in the age of machines
results.creator_credit: Academy Film Productions, Ronald Mason and Giorgio Mangiamele
results.brief_description: Presents the many opportunities available today in the field of engineering. Shows a typical machine-shop where a young apprentice follows the production of a pattern from the drawing board design to the casting being finished in the dressing shop. Outlines various diploma and degree courses; employment opportunities based on educational qualifications; preliminary subjects required in basic education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Academy Film Productions, Ronald Mason and Giorgio Mangiamele

results.title: Organizing the school day
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Two teachers bring twenty children together for meeting time at the start of the day in order to organise the day ahead.

results.title: The Art teacher has nine kittens
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A basket of kittens serves as a vehicle for experiences in classifying, counting, and colour recognition, and extends an understanding of the birth and care of young animals for a kindergarten class.

results.title: Sir, you forgot to pay
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Experience with numbers, dramatic play and concept formation are among the aims behind conducting a store in a classroom situation. Activities include experiment with barter, use of an adding machine and cash register, and the purchase of merchandise. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Some have magnetic properties
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
In this film a teacher gives egg cartons filled with magnets to the children, encouraging them to discover which have magnetic properties. Various children explore contacts with iron filings, a compass, paper clips, and numerous other objects. Freedom not to be involved is open to the children here, but they are on the whole, quite involved in the project.
results.creator_credit_for_label: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation

results.title: Free play and music
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Children are encouraged to select toys or materials which interest them, each child directing his own activity with the objects. Music periods involve singing accompanied by physical participation.

results.title: The Gathering drum
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
At the beginning of the kindergarten day children are encouraged to move freely and choose from a variety of play objects. A drumbeat then brings them together to be introduced to the day’s activities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation

results.title: I'll play my guitar softly
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Kindergarten children are observed here responding to the rhythm of music. The teacher, while playing a guitar, encourages different responses at different times, sometimes the rhythmic cadence of sticks and sometimes a vocal response. At the conclusion the children disperse in an orderly way for refreshment and “quiet time”.
